discussion.author: Tragicus
discussion.comment:
Lines 714-811 contain the roots-coefficients relations for a polynomial. Should it go to mathcomp or should I put it in the xmathcomp directory (or have I just not seen it in the library)?

Should I try to go further, hopefully replacing the 0 characteristic hypothesis by some separability hypothesis?

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
> Lines 714-811 contain the roots-coefficients relations for a polynomial. Should it go to mathcomp or should I put it in the xmathcomp directory (or have I just not seen it in the library)?

Both! (To my knowledge it's been done only for [multivariate polynomials](https://github.com/math-comp/multinomials/blob/ce1bdcf59dbdf7d7ac49637d4ab2df94e12ed4e2/src/mpoly.v#L4538-L4540))

> Should I try to go further, hopefully replacing the 0 characteristic hypothesis by some separability hypothesis?

If you want, yes please!

discussion.author: Tragicus
discussion.comment: In fact, what I did is not complete. I proved that any extension that is solvable by radical is solvable in any characteristic, but not the converse, so AbelGalois still requires a root of unity, which makes my generalization pretty useless. When I try to prove the missing part following Lang's Algebra book, I need to prove that the galois trace is not 0, which relies on the independance of characters, whose proof takes two different characters and chooses a point where they differ. This is supposed to be applied to members of a galois group, whose domains are infinite, which makes this step non-constructive. Is there a constructive proof of this theorem, or else what should I do, I guess we do not want to rely on boolp from mathcomp-analysis ?

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment:
This was here: https://github.com/math-comp/Abel/blob/94499667cc4464f7748a2fd909e628a8f86a998e/theories/xmathcomp/various.v#L265-L266
And it's being ported to mathcomp in this PR: https://github.com/math-comp/math-comp/pull/944/files#diff-2d6a4ea70d7630c940ac8075abbc6ff46d30c54f80c29291131b711b195368e6R1839

commits.author: CohenCyril
commits.message:
Complete Proof of Abel Galois minus one result about cyclotomic poly

The file `abel.v` is stripped from most preliminary results, which are
dispatched across other files.

- `abel.v` itself contains the main theorems:
  + `galois_solvable_by_radical` (requires explicit roots of unity),
  + `ext_solvable_by_radical` (equivalent, and still requires roots of unity),
  + `radical_solvable_ext` (no mention of roots of unity),
  + `AbelGalois`, (equivalence obtained from the above to, requires
    roots of unity)
   and their consequence `example_not_solvable_by_radicals`

- `various.v` contains various (rather straightforward) extensions that
  should be added to various mathcomp packages asap,

- `char0.v` contains 0 characteristic specific results, that could use a
  refactoring for a smoother integration with mathcomp. e.g. ratr gets
  a canonical structure or rmorphism when the target field is a
  lmodType ratr, and we provide a wrapper NullCharType akin to
  PrimeCharType (from finfield.v),

- `cyclotomic.v` contains complementary results about cyclotomic
  polynomials, (there is still one admit),

- `map_gal.v` contains complementary results about galois groups and
  galois extensions, including various isomorphisms, minimal galois
  extensions, solvable extensions, and mapping galois groups and
  galois extensions from a splitting field to another. This last
  construction is essential in switching to fields with roots of unity
  when we do not have them yet,

- `classic_ext.v` contains the theory of classic extensions by arbitrary
  polynomials, most of the results there are in the classically monad,
  making the results available either for a boolean goal or a
  classical goal. This was instrumental in eliminating references to
  some embarrassing roots of the unity.

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
Since I reorganized the code, this PR should be closed in favor of #35.
@amahboubi If you continued your proof without synchronizing it at some point, you can continue to push here and we'll make the transition together. Otherwise please edit and extend #35 instead, the proof to finish is located in `xmathcomp/cyclotomic.v` and the immediate context should be exactly the same as the one you had. If you need fancy new results about galois theory, you should additionally require `map_gal.v`.

commits.author: CohenCyril
commits.message:
Understood intent behind galois_splittingFieldFor and fixed

The statement was wrong but the idea was that in null characteristic,
any extension is separable, because all minimal polynomials are.
This is now proven, and may be used in some specific cases.

commits.author: CohenCyril
commits.message:
WIP: part1a : radical.-ext E F

This is particulary tricky because:
- it involves establishing a correspondance between matrices and
  galois groups.  This is done throught the incomplete galmx.v
- establishing results about codiagonalisation
  (I take inspiration from spectral.v, but there is too little in
  common for now...)
- establishing a correspondance between the mxminpoly of a matrix and
  the polynomial \prod (X - d) where d are the diagonal coefficients.
  (missing).
- juggling between L and fieldOver E, which are basically
  isomoporphic, but not many results are transportable.

Additonnally:
- some faulty `{vspace L}` were changed to `{subfield L}` in abel.v
- some context variable are localized to lemmas to allow easier `move:`
- mxextra.v is unused (it is dead code)
- default.nix is updated to use mathcomp 1.10.0 + finmap 1.4.0
  (please make sure you did `cachix use math-comp`
   to get quickly in the right context)
